text: Amélie Mauresmo was the defending champion, but lost in Quarterfinals to Serena Williams. Justine Henin won the title, defeating Serena Williams 6–2, 1–6, 7–6(7–5) in the final. ==Seeds== The top eight seeds receive a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ====Section 1==== ====Section 2==== ===Bottom Half=== ====Section 3==== ====Section 4==== ==External links== *Main and Qualifying Draws Eurocard German Open - Singles Category:WTA German Open
title: 2002 WTA German Open – Singles
